meaning: The category that a piece of data can be put into
A whole number
A number with a decimal point
A binary value which is either true or false
A single letter, number, or symbol
A sequence of characters
A memory location storing data that can be changed
A value that cannot be changed
The process of storing a value in a variable
Repetition of a certain piece of code
A decision that determines which piece of code is run
A piece of code that can be reused throughout the program by calling it.
A subroutine that does not return a value
A subroutine that returns a value
A loop that repeats a certain number of times
A loop that repeats until a certain condition is met
A selection inside another selection
An iteration inside another iteration
The mathematical operations that can be performed on integer and real numbers
The process of adding two numbers together
The process of taking one number away from another
The process of multiplying two numbers together
The process of dividing one number by another to receive a value with a decimal point
The process of dividing one number by another and rounding down to the nearest whole number
Comparing the values of two numbers
The process of checking if two numbers are equal
The process of checking if two numbers are not equal
The process of checking if one number is less than another
The process of checking if one number is greater than another
The process of checking if one number is less than or equal to another
The process of checking if one number is greater than or equal to another
The operations that can be performed on boolean values
Inverts a boolean value
Returns true if both values are true
Returns true if either value is true
A way of storing and organising data
A data structure that stores data in a sequence
A data structure that stores data in a key-value pair
The number of items in a data structure
The index of an item in a data structure
A section of a string
The process of joining two strings together
The values that are passed into a subroutine
A variable that is only accessible within a subroutine
A variable that is accessible within and outside of a subroutine
A type of algorithm that checks if a value is valid
The process of verifying the identity of a user
Data that should not cause an error when the program is run
Data that is on the boundaries of the limits specified in the algorithm
Data that should cause an error when the program is run
An error that occurs when the program uses invalid syntax that can not be understood by the compiler
An error that does not stop the program from running, but yields an output that would not be expected
